Description: Textile, perhaps from a curtain, printed in red and purple-brown on an undyed cotton ground. Three types of repeating design: in an upper band, alternating squares containing four diamonds or a lattice pattern: main field has six-petalled flowers on a diagonal arrangement of stylised leaves and stems. Lower band of narrow niches between columns both with pointed trefoil finials. Plain stripes separate the different designs. A row of small flowers across the lower edge. Part of decorated border also survives.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), Courtyard (south-west of) Grave LC
Exhibition history: Exhibition History: 2017-2018, 10 Nov 2017 - 18 Feb 2018, Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya (CSMVS), Mumbai, India, India and the World: A History in Nine Stories 2018, 6 May- 30 June, National Museum, New Delhi, India and the World: A History in Nine Stories
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
